info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 10 at 4:16AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee/Sullivan WI
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Wisconsin...
Kinnickinnic River At Milwaukee affecting Milwaukee County.
* WHAT...Major flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Kinnickinnic River at Milwaukee.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Floodwaters are about 2 feet over the top of the concrete-lined channel and affect homes in the neighborhood adjacent to the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM CDT Sunday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 07/13/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
